Description: Body sherd of Attic red-figured pottery calyx-krater; outside, head and arm of Athena wearing a helmet and holding a spear, head (lost) turned to left, bracelet in added white paint around wrist; on the right, head and raised right hand of bearded satyr facing left; inside black glaze with narrow reserved band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 64, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1000)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: VII.B.4 (cat. no. in Prins de Jong 1925)
